title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 November 2011 - XWiki
content:
00:14 <CIA-102> Sorin Burjan master \* r34914ae / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.properties : XWIKI-7173: Wrong example in the source parameter of Dashboard Macro in WYSIWYG Editor ...  
00:14 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r9061578 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.properties : Merge pull request #28 from sorinello/master ...  
00:36 <mflorea> has quit  
00:40 <nbetcher> has joined #xwiki  
00:41 <nbetcher> Hello.  
00:41 <nbetcher> sdumitriu: You around?  
00:41 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
00:41 <@sdumitriu> Hi  
00:41 <@sdumitriu> Sorry for dropping out last time  
00:42 <@sdumitriu> So, any progress?  
00:42 <nbetcher> Nope, none :(  
00:42 <@sdumitriu> Do you have a public URL?  
00:42 <nbetcher> No  
00:42 <nbetcher> I'm not the admin, so I can't open a port  
00:43 <nbetcher> Plus we host patient data  
00:43 <@sdumitriu> Right, I know how that works  
00:43 <@sdumitriu> Confientiality  
00:43 <nbetcher> Federal law :P  
00:43 <@sdumitriu> OK...  
00:43 <@sdumitriu> What browser are you using?  
00:44 <nbetcher> Chrome 16, but it happens in IE8/9 and Firefox 4  
00:44 <nbetcher> Lets forget about the WYSIWYG issue - that seems to not be the issue  
00:44 <nbetcher> the main problem is that after importing the XAR and then logging in, everything results in 403  
00:44 <nbetcher> Without logging in, everything public displays properly  
00:45 <nbetcher> Whenever the Xwiki 403 error happens Tomcat whines  
00:47 <@sdumitriu> Did you exclude XWiki.XWikiAllGroup from the import?  
00:47 <nbetcher> I didn't change the default import selections and from what I recall it imports everything by default  
00:48 <nbetcher> I can export the database/etc... the wiki doesn't contain any patient specific data itself  
00:49 <@sdumitriu> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HUpgradingwikidocuments  
00:50 <@sdumitriu> When importing, did you select the "Add a new version" method?  
00:50 <nbetcher> Yes, default  
00:50 <nbetcher> I've tried the third options sometimes though  
00:52 <nbetcher> Let me try changing my XAR import selections. What method would you suggest when importing the pages?  
00:56 <@sdumitriu> Too late for now, go to the history of the XWiki.XWikiAllGroup  
00:57 <@sdumitriu> And try to rollback to the version before the import  
00:58 <nbetcher> I can't because doing ANYTHING results in a 403, so I have to revert the DB  
00:59 <@sdumitriu> OK  
00:59 <@sdumitriu> If you imported the default XAR, you should be able to login with the Admin/admin user  
01:00 <@sdumitriu> (make sure you change the password on that one after logging in since it's an open security hole otherwise)  
01:03 <nbetcher> I'm trying the method you linked  
01:03 <nbetcher> Should I "Add a new version to the existing document", "Replace the document history with the history from the package", or "Reset history to version 1.1"?  
01:03 <nbetcher> I do not care about revision history  
01:05 <nbetcher> And what is this "Import as backup package"?  
01:05 <@sdumitriu> Just leave the Add new version option, but make sure you uncheck some of the documents, as listed on the Upgrade page I linked above  
01:08 <nbetcher> Yup  
01:08 <nbetcher> And do I want to uncheck "Import as backup package"?  
01:08 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
01:08 <nbetcher> ok  
01:17 <nbetcher> Weird... same thing  
01:17 <@sdumitriu> Weird...  
01:17 <@sdumitriu> OK, try logging out and in with the Admin user  
01:17 <nbetcher> What's the default admin login?  
01:20 <@sdumitriu> Username: Admin  
01:20 <@sdumitriu> password: admin  
01:20 <nbetcher> great, must have changed it and not written it down. Time to revert again >.>  
01:24 <nbetcher> What part of the XAR replaces the WYSIWYG engine?  
01:28 <@sdumitriu> In the XWiki space, documents containing WYSIWYG in their name  
01:32 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
01:33 <nbetcher> Ok, so I skipped importing everything except for the WYSIWYG stuff and it works now :)  
01:34 <nbetcher> Now I just have to figure out why office macros are failing  
01:34 <nbetcher> ahh, I see  
01:36 <nbetcher> will spaces/dashes/etc be allowed in filenames anytime soon?  
01:37 <@sdumitriu> Ah, attachments?  
01:37 <nbetcher> yes  
01:37 <@sdumitriu> It's something we want to do but never find the time to sit down on it and test thoroughy  
01:38 <nbetcher> Would be very helpful so that we can index pages with attachments with more meaningful labels  
01:38 <nbetcher> if it were up to me, I'd get my company to pay you guys to do it :P  
01:40 <@sdumitriu> :)  
01:41 <@sdumitriu> Vote on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XE-324  
01:44 <nbetcher> voted :D  
01:45 <nbetcher> Wow, I'm so glad everything seems to work... some macros were failing before too, but that seems to not be the case now  
01:45 <nbetcher> was dreading having to rewrite them  
01:46 <nbetcher> Thanks so much for your help and the great product! :)  
01:46 <nbetcher> has left #xwiki  
01:46 <@sdumitriu> Macros not working is usually a "missing programming rights" issue  
01:55 <jvdrean> has quit  
03:15 <DrLou> has quit  
03:51 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
05:50 <DrLou> has quit  
06:01 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:02 <Denis> has quit  
07:19 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:42 <tekzilla> has quit  
07:45 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
07:58 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:03 <vmassol> has quit  
09:18 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:47 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <Denis> has quit  
09:51 <nIMBVS> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <nIMBVS> hi. where does xwiki hold the attachments? I didn't find any on the filesystem. It holds them in the database?  
10:10 <+sburjan> nIMBVS: if you haven't enabled the file system storage, attachments are stored in the database, yes  
10:16 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
10:26 <nIMBVS> ok. I found instructions about filesystem storage and transferred them to the filesystem  
10:35 <+sburjan> cool  
10:35 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <evalica> has quit  
11:37 <nIMBVS> I'm trying to configure xwiki to run on root path (like wiki.example.com). I configured xwiki.webapppath= and xwiki.home=http://wiki.example.com/, but the paths are all generated with /xwiki  
11:37 <nIMBVS> like http://wiki.example.com/xwiki/bin/etc/  
11:38 <nIMBVS> instead of http://wiki.example.com/bin/etc/  
11:38 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <@sdumitriu> nIMBVS: Did you read http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ShortURLs  
11:43 <+sburjan> nIMBVS: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ShortURLs#HApplicationname  
11:44 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
11:46 <CIA-102> Denis Gervalle master \* r28e3f25 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/repository/internal/DefaultExtensionSerializer.java : XWIKI-7174: NPE for authors URLs during serialization of an extension to the local filesystem - http://git.io/ZxFQOg  
11:48 <@sdumitriu> Denis: I was just about to do that  
11:48 <@sdumitriu> (commit it)  
11:48 <+Denis> sdumitriu: there were no JIRA, so I have done it :)  
11:48 <@sdumitriu> No problem  
11:48 <@sdumitriu> Saved me some time  
11:49 <+Denis> sdumitriu: I suppose that your UI works will fix authors display  
11:50 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
11:50 <@sdumitriu> Committing in a few minutes  
11:51 <nIMBVS> sdumitriu: I'm actually trying to integrate xwiki with apache, mod\_proxy\_ajp  
11:51 <nIMBVS> I have something like this in my config: http://pastebin.com/aHrHF05u  
11:51 <nIMBVS> any idea where I might be wrong?  
11:52 <@sdumitriu> nIMBVS: I'm not sure, but I think that it's impossible to redefine the application path from the apache httpd configuration  
11:53 <@sdumitriu> Since XWiki gets that information not from the URL, but from the servlet container itself  
11:55 <nIMBVS> if I rewrite the URLs with mod\_rewrite, to get rid of the xwiki part, do you think it will work?  
11:57 <@sdumitriu> No idea, I rarely handle installation  
11:58 <nIMBVS> what about xwiki.webapppath= in xwiki.cfg? shouldn't this force the URLs to be created without the xwiki/ part?  
11:59 <nIMBVS> it doesn't seem to have any effect...  
12:01 <jvdrean> has quit  
12:01 <@sdumitriu> Yeah, that's the same as "not set", so the value is obtained from the container  
12:01 <@sdumitriu> Try using / as the value  
12:01 <@sdumitriu> You might get .com//bin  
12:02 <@sdumitriu> But the safest solution would be to just deploy XWiki as the ROOT webapp, although it might be impossible for you to do that  
12:06 <+sburjan> hello sdumitriu . you commented on the jira i reported yesterday. You wanted to say that that issue shouldn't be reported at all or should have been reported as task/sub-task ?  
12:08 <@sdumitriu> Not at all  
12:08 <@sdumitriu> But since you already reported it, I just transformed it as a subtask  
12:08 <+sburjan> but why shouldn't have been reported ? it was an error there  
12:08 <@sdumitriu> Yes, but not in Milestone 1  
12:09 <+sburjan> well it's in between  
12:09 <@sdumitriu> Right  
12:09 <+sburjan> afaik we report in-between bugs too  
12:09 <@sdumitriu> Does it reproduce on a clean M1?  
12:09 <+sburjan> nope  
12:09 <+sburjan> then what should I have put instead of M1 ?  
12:09 <@sdumitriu> Then it has no version to affect, so it can't be reported as a bug  
12:10 <@sdumitriu> You should have reopened the other bug and put the problem in a comment  
12:11 <+sburjan> so only a pull request + a comment whould have been the correct approach  
12:12 <+sburjan> ok, thanks  
12:12 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r1eb11cb / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-administration/src/main/resources/XWiki/ForgotUsername.xml : [misc] Fixed missing source file XML escape - http://git.io/m7Cheg  
12:12 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rfbbcadc / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-administration/src/main/resources/XWiki/GoogleAnalyticsCode.xml : [cleanup] Applied codestyle - http://git.io/OZslCg  
12:12 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rac13997 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/pdfcover.vm : [misc] Make it easier to style the author and date on the PDF export cover - http://git.io/Bow2hQ  
12:12 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r78a1dfb / (7 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-6775: Extension Manager UI improvements ...  
12:17 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: I get a "org.infinispan:infinispan-core 5.0.1.FINAL ${packaging}" in the core extension in EM table  
12:17 <+sburjan> missing version  
12:18 <+sburjan> no, missing packaging  
12:18 <@sdumitriu> Report a bug  
12:18 <+sburjan> "Third party core extensions" table more exactly  
12:19 <+sburjan> yes, but this might not affect M1, I'll have to check  
12:22 <+sburjan> it reproduces on M1, I'll report it  
12:31 <sdumitriu> has quit  
12:37 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki
